page.title: 17MARKET RASEN -FARMING
page.content: From the early days when there were 2 large arable fields with the pastures and grazing aoround the town. After enclosure in 1780 the modern field system was evolved. Livestock however remains important with large flocks of sheep grazing on land let each year for that purpose. There are also small herds of Lincoln Red cattle to be seen.Dairy herds of Freisian cows are present in the area too.But, it is the arable farming which shows the most changes. Highly mechanised farms with an acreage of about 300 are found growing mostly potatoes, cereals, sugar beet and more recently oilseed rape.Peas are also grown (freezing carried out at Grimsby)but the acreage has declined.There is a considerable acreage of grass too. The town provides many services for the farmers including vets.machinery and supplies.
